Sentencas: Chemical looping combustion technology is essential to achieve efficient decarbonized electricity generation for fossil-fueled power plants.
Titulo: Thermodynamic and optimization analysis of a fuel cell-based combined cooling, heating, and power system integrated with LNG-fueled chemical looping hydrogen generation

Sentencas: However, the existing chemical looping hydrogen generation (CLHG)-driven cogeneration systems have complex refrigeration units and energy-consuming carbon capture.
Titulo: Thermodynamic and optimization analysis of a fuel cell-based combined cooling, heating, and power system integrated with LNG-fueled chemical looping hydrogen generation

Sentencas: This study proposes a novel solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC)-based combined cooling, heating, and power (CCHP) system, which is integrated with the CLHG and fueled by a liquid natural gas (LNG) regasification process.
Titulo: Thermodynamic and optimization analysis of a fuel cell-based combined cooling, heating, and power system integrated with LNG-fueled chemical looping hydrogen generation

Sentencas: The system is designed to enhance the overall performance by directly recovering LNG cold energy for cooling and liquefying the resulting CO2.
Titulo: Thermodynamic and optimization analysis of a fuel cell-based combined cooling, heating, and power system integrated with LNG-fueled chemical looping hydrogen generation

Sentencas: The energy and exergy performance of the system under the baseline design case are evaluated.
Titulo: Thermodynamic and optimization analysis of a fuel cell-based combined cooling, heating, and power system integrated with LNG-fueled chemical looping hydrogen generation

Sentencas: Subsequently, we discuss the impact of key design parameters on system performance and weigh between cooling/ heating power and net power generation for the system dominated by the combined heat and power (CHP)/ combined cooling and power (CCP) mode.
Titulo: Thermodynamic and optimization analysis of a fuel cell-based combined cooling, heating, and power system integrated with LNG-fueled chemical looping hydrogen generation

Sentencas: Our findings reveal that the proposed system exhibits an electrical efficiency of 66.92 % and an exergy efficiency of 53.94 % under the baseline design case.
Titulo: Thermodynamic and optimization analysis of a fuel cell-based combined cooling, heating, and power system integrated with LNG-fueled chemical looping hydrogen generation

Sentencas: The exergy loss ratio for condenser1 is identified as the highest among all components, accounting for 29.50 %.
Titulo: Thermodynamic and optimization analysis of a fuel cell-based combined cooling, heating, and power system integrated with LNG-fueled chemical looping hydrogen generation

Sentencas: The constituent unit with the largest exergy loss contribution is the LNG regasification unit, followed by the SOFC unit, CLHG unit, transcritical CO2 cycle unit, and heating unit.
Titulo: Thermodynamic and optimization analysis of a fuel cell-based combined cooling, heating, and power system integrated with LNG-fueled chemical looping hydrogen generation

Sentencas: More hydrogen needs to be replenished when fuel flow in the CLHG and fuel utilization in the SOFC are used to improve system performance.
Titulo: Thermodynamic and optimization analysis of a fuel cell-based combined cooling, heating, and power system integrated with LNG-fueled chemical looping hydrogen generation

Sentencas: The optimal electrical and exergy efficiencies of the system predominantly designed in CCP mode surpass those in CHP mode by 4.27 % and 0.57 %, respectively.
Titulo: Thermodynamic and optimization analysis of a fuel cell-based combined cooling, heating, and power system integrated with LNG-fueled chemical looping hydrogen generation

Sentencas: The results can guide potential applications of CLHG-based cogeneration systems.
Titulo: Thermodynamic and optimization analysis of a fuel cell-based combined cooling, heating, and power system integrated with LNG-fueled chemical looping hydrogen generation
